bartMachine_i_prior_cov_spec
public abstract class bartMachine_h_eval extends bartMachine_g_mh implements Serializable
This portion of the code performs the evaluation / prediction on the BART model

  • Method Details

    • Evaluate

      public double Evaluate(double[] record, int num_cores_evaluate)
      The default BART evaluation of a new observations is done via sample average of the posterior predictions. Other functions can be used here such as median, mode, etc.
      Specified by:
      Evaluate in class Classifier
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
      Returns:
      The prediction

    • EvaluateViaSampAvg

      public double EvaluateViaSampAvg(double[] record, int num_cores_evaluate)
      Evaluates a new observations via sample average of the posterior predictions.
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation

    • EvaluateViaSampMed

      public double EvaluateViaSampMed(double[] record, int num_cores_evaluate)
      Evaluates a new observations via sample median of the posterior predictions.
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation

    • getGibbsSamplesForPrediction

      protected double[] getGibbsSamplesForPrediction(double[] record, int num_cores_evaluate)
      For each sum-of-trees in each psoterior of the Gibbs samples, evaluate / predict these new records by summing over the prediction for each tree
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
      Returns:
      The predicted values as the result of the sum over many trees for all posterior gibbs samples

    • getPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction

      protected double[] getPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction(double[] record, double coverage, int num_cores_evaluate)
      For each sum-of-trees in each psoterior of the Gibbs samples, evaluate / predict these new records by summing over the prediction for each tree then order these by value and create an uncertainty interval
      Parameters:
      record - The observation for which to create an uncertainty interval
      coverage - The percent coverage (between 0 and 1)
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
      Returns:
      A tuple which is the lower value in the interval followed by the higher value

    • get95PctPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction

      protected double[] get95PctPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction(double[] record, int num_cores_evaluate)
      For each sum-of-trees in each psoterior of the Gibbs samples, evaluate / predict these new records by summing over the prediction for each tree then order these by value and create a 95% uncertainty interval
      Parameters:
      record - The observation for which to create an uncertainty interval
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
      Returns:
      A tuple which is the lower value in the 95% interval followed by the higher value
